c74object.name: bach.reshape
c74object.digest: Impose to an llll the structure of another
c74object.description: Changes the structure of an llll according to the structure of another.

inlet.description: The llll whose structure should be changed.
The llll whose structure should be imposed to the llll in the left inlet.

method.name: bang
method.description: The result of reshaping the two most recently received lllls is output.

method.name: llll
method.description: The structure of an llll in the left inlet is changed according to the structure of an llll in the right inlet. Moreover, when an llll is received in the left inlet the reshaped llll is output.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: llll with contents. The llll whose structure should be changed.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: llll with structer. The llll whose structure should be imposed to the llll in the left inlet.
